author: Anton Frolov
comment: Does it have the shuffle option? I always shuffle my playlists (who doesn't?) and it can't be done from the watch menu?

author: Blake Smith
comment: Cut my Huawei Watch 1's (Android Wear 2.0) battery in half. Even force stopping the app from the apps menu did not improve it. Watch wouldn't make it seven hours with this app installed.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Blake, I just released a new version to the beta channel that has some aggressive battery saving options I'd love for you to try! You can opt in here http://bit.ly/musicbossbeta

author: Steelo
comment: Album art not showing up, tried on Google Play Music, Spotify & Apple Music

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Hi Steelo. Could you please try restarting your phone and trying again. All these apps should be consistently showing album art. Feel free to email me for help. rebootsramblings@gmail.com

author: Joshua Bagwell
comment: Incredibly inconsistent. The app opens on its own when it wants to. The swipe feature is why I bought this, but if I still have to look at the watch to see if my swipes are working, it defeats the purpose. For 3 dollars, at least make a product that works.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Hi Joshua. You can disable the auto launching in the Phone app under settings/Watch App. The swipe sensitivity can be adjusted in the wear app by double tapping the media screen/Settings/General. I'd love to help troubleshoot further and I am always open to improving the app. rebootsramblings@gmail.com

author: Victor Ruskovoloshin
comment: Excellent, high quality app. First and most important it works with all the players I tried - Media Monkey, Player Pro, Pandora and Spotify. It's fully configurable. I really like how the controls are implemented. The embedded tutorial (!) really helps, use it and you will love the app. Good job guys, congrats!

author: Raul Huerta
comment: This app does not find any music in my device, I have 2 downloaded albums on my moto 360 sport and it does not show anything. Not even has an option to search for music. This is a rip off.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Hi Raul. Please send me a quick email to discuss. This app is a remote control for apps running on the phone and not music on the watch itself. rebootsramblings@gmail.com

author: Sue & Rick Chester
comment: Works well with Sonos when devices are connected to the network.   Polar m600.  Nice job!

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Thanks for the great feedback. Enjoy!

author: Николай Ушанов
comment: Spent 10 mins and didn't find the way to show album art on watches for Google play music. Then saw that art is not showing for some albums only... Strange

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: I would be happy to help. Please send me a quick email. rebootsramblings@gmail.com

author: Iain William Davidson
comment: No matter how this app gets set up, it only ever shows the Google play music song and artist.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Hi Iain. I'd love to help you get it set up. Please send me a quick email to get started rebootsramblings@gmail.com

author: Mattaniah Beezy
comment: What a music controller should be

author: RC
comment: Easy Gesture-based control I've used Music Boss for Pebble, which worked fantastic. I only got rid of the Pebble because it's a crappy watch. But with my MB experience, I decided to buy the Android Wear version when I got my Asus ZenWatch 2. I love the gesture-based control, making it easier to control my Podcast Addict app.   I've only just had this app for a few minutes, so I'm withholding the final star for a bit, since there's some delay between fast forward and rewind. I'll adjust the review later as appropriate.

author: Evil Master
comment: I personally use this app to launch the music player that my Note 4 comes with (for my Moto 360), this because this default music player fits in with the controls that are added on my S-View cover. The only downside is I have to use the voice commands: “Ok Google“, “Start music boss“. Yet it would be cooler if it could take over the "Play music" command and go right away. Still 5/5 as it does as expected and integrates really well with my default music player, rather than Google music.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Hi! Really glad you're enjoying the app. Because Music Boss is not a music playing app, it wouldn't be able to take over the "play music" commands. This command is reserved for music players. Thanks for the great feedback and have a great day :)

title: Really great integrated

author: Josh Landis
comment: Simplifies Wear music control PERFECTLY. Awesome for driving since I no longer have to take my eyes off the road to navigate my smartwatch to change a song. I couldn't have made it any better myself (which I was contemplating lol).  My only criticisms are only with UI navigation.  Suggestion 1 - Add a floating action button to the bottom right for adding apps to control.  Suggestion 2 - Use checkboxes to allow multiple apps to be selected.

author: Tyler Woodfin
comment: I had to buy this twice, after it stopped working and I decided to uninstall: Google Play could no longer find my version in the Play Store, and I had to repurchase. This new version will close when my screen goes into ambient mode, and no amount of settings changes seems to fix the issue.
title: Closes When Screen Off on Smartwatch 3

author: Andrius Mateikis
comment: App is kind of useless. When it works it works but when it doesn't then it just doesn't. And doesn't work most of the time for me. It shuts off by itself and just disappears from my screen. Really bad battery drain. Would have been better off with one of the free apps.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: The app should not be turning off by itself. Did you enable a timeout in the wear app settings? This app fully supports ambient mode and is set to be "Always On". I'm happy to help via email. rebootsramblings@gmail.com

author: Richard Hay
comment: The app worked great on day 1, but the next day crashes my watch on launch every time. Uninstalling until resolved. ***Update after reinstalling app no longer crashes, but it seems it is very hard to stop on my watch. Even after I quit the app or restart my watch there is always a card for MB top of the queue ready to accidentally start a song. If I'm not careful my phone will start blaring music while I'm checking other cards or just by gestures on the watch.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Hi Richard. You can change this behaviour on the Music Boss phone app under Settings>Notification.

title: Worked once now crashes each launch

author: Stephen B
comment: The app crashes all the time on my LG Urbane and it lags when it is working (this is the only app on my watch).  I also am using a note 5 that had android 5 and 6 installed when the app crashed on my watch....reinstalled app and still does it. Trash app

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Hi Stephen, I would have been happy to troubleshoot with you before your review. Could you please contact me to discuss. rebootsramblings@gmail.com

title: Crashes constantly!

author: Matt Bruman
comment: Lately having issue where it closes on screen off, also wish there was a way for it to replace the play music notification since having two notification about the song playing is confusing and difficult to pick the right one to launch MB mode.
title: Works well most of the time.

author: Caleb Schlossin
comment: Single best app I've find for android wear. Control all your music/podcast apps with simple gestures from a single app. Great integration with tasker. Glad this was recommended to me, couldn't be without it.
title: Best Android Wear app

author: boobady bibady
comment: A good app that does exactley what it says on the tin, remote controls music player from your watch. However its still missing an element that I thought would be a standard on these apps, it won't let you browse the music library on your phone. You can only skip tracks forward or back, you can't change album or playlist from the watch meaning you still need to get your phone out if you fancy something different. If library functions were added as a feature this would be perfect!

author: Chris Harrington
comment: How do you rate songs?  It should be one tap or swipe to get to that screen

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: When controlling Google Play Music you just double tap the watch screen and rate.

title: Overly confusing

author: Jake Hiegel
comment: Do not install. It makes your Music experience worse and You can't get a refund.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Hi. I would have gladly refunded the app within a couple of days of purchase if you were having issues. Please email me next time before making false statements.

title: Makes Bluetooth clip

author: Christopher Schuhart
comment: Loved Music Boss for Pebble, now rocking Music Boss for Android Wear. Well done!! 😁
title: Home run!!

author: Artemio Sanchez
comment: I was having a syncing problem with gps (google play services) my phone had the newest gps but it wouldn't sync over to my watch rendering the app useless. Luckily the developer walked me through steps on how to fix the problem and everything is back to normal. I would recommend this to anyone!

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: This means your watch has not updated to Google Play Service 8.4. Please allow the watch to update to GPS 8.4 to match the phone app and the app will work. I would have been happy to help you with this before negative feedback.

title: Works like a charm and the developer is great

author: Adrian Lee
comment: The app brings much needed functionality to Android Wear, specifically ambient mode music info & control.  Had a minor issue with the Wear app not showing album art, contacted the developer and it was fixed within the week. Great support, highly recommended!

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Thanks for reporting the issue. I'm really glad we got everything working correctly.

author: Lyo Faelan
comment: Fantastic app, fantastic dev. Been using Music Boss since I owned a Pebble, now with a Moto 360 it's still a fantastic replacement for the built-in controls. Frequently updated, stable, and works well. Developer is prompt to respond to technical issues, great attitude as well.

author: Stefan
comment: Best app for Android Wear media control. The developer personally helped me when I had an issue with the app; he was polite, courteous, and responded in a timely manner. Overall I have a great experience using Music Boss, and I'm glad I purchased it as it is one of the most used apps on my smartwatch.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: It's always a pleasure to help people with my apps. Have a great day.

author: Casper Talvio
comment: The transparency option is great! Would  like the option to dim the cover art as well. I also have an issue where the cover art instantly disappears after only showing up for a split second.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Hi Casper. That is a battery saving feature for when you tilt the watch away. You can disable the "Black Theme" in the wear app settings > Battery Saving. Feel free to email me: rebootsramblings@gmail.com

title: Tweaks

author: Kaibosh
comment: I used Music Boss for Pebble for ages and loved it. As soon as I switched to Android Wear I bought this version and was extremely disappointed so ditched it. Gave it another chance recently and am very glad I did - it's basically a different app from what it was initially, and is now getting as much use as the Pebble version used to - completely replacing how I listen to and control my music from my watch.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Kaibosh, I really appreciate the feedback. I am very happy you're back in action!

title: Awesome addition, after a rocky start

author: Andrey Kurenkov
comment: I was quite disappointed with the default music controls in Android Wear, which did not work when my phone had its screen turned off. Luckily, this app works great and the full-screen mode is actually better than the default UI. This is probably the main use for a smartwatch for me, I think.

author: Jayson Rondilla
comment: Works as advertised.  My only problem is that the album art that is displayed on my G Watch R does not update upon tracking when my phone screen is off.  Album art immediately updates when I turn on my phone screen. **Update**  It seems my problem lies with poweramp and its way they implement id3 album update.  This problem is not present in google play music and playerpro.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Hey Jayson, I replied to your email. Looking forward to helping you.

author: Bruce Robertson
comment: On my Sony SW3 it was draining the battery in about 2 hours. I contacted the developer and he responded that he was working on an update. Well he updated the app and now it's working fine with little or no battery drain.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: This is excellent news. Thanks for the feedback.

title: Disappointed at first, now great!

author: Jamie Green
comment: Im using a moto 360 and it may just be me not having something right, it's not showing any music info for Pandora and seems to always show music from Google play music which I don't even use. Any chance you could help me get this fixed I'd appreciate it! Even though it doesn't show the right music info I'm still able to change tracks /play/pause.     UPDATE got that working thanks! Now is there a way to get it to show album art? I tried emailing you guys but for some reason it wouldn't go through.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: I can definitely help with this. You can expand Pandora in the MB phone app and choose "Capture status bar media info". If that doesn't work, please try restarting your phone. More help available at rebootsramblings@gmail.com

title: Having issues

author: Lamer Linux
comment: I got this app for my Pebble and got me a new Smart watch an Android Wear and they're great I use it for my Internet radio and it works great at it. Make sure you connect your Smart Watch on Bluetooth not WiFi. Thanks for making this app. If you people look for an App like this it's worth it even for the Pebble version (if you got the Pebble Smart Watch)

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Cody, send me a quick email and we'll see what's going on. rebootsramblings@gmail.com

title: The best app ever on Android Wear

author: Roy lovelock
comment: Love the app but something is not right, it's is causing high drain and slowing the phone to a crawl. I'm having to uninstal until it gets fixed, my phone is red hot

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Roy, sorry to hear this. Can you please send me a quick message. If battery drain occurred, did you try restarting your phone? rebootsramblings@gmail.com

title: Slowing phone

author: Becky Bee
comment: I think it was $2... I have a moto 360 and Bluetooth in my car. When I get into the car I can start my audiobook just by opening music boss on my watch.  Works with jet audio and smart audiobook player. Very very awesome!
title: Best $2 I ever spent on an app

author: Ralph Gonzalez
comment: This is is overall terrible. Takes forever forever to respond and never syncs with the appropriate app. Voice controls basically do nothing. Total waste.

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Ralph, I would have been happy to help you with the app's feature before you left your review and am still willing. Send me a quick email to discuss if you are willing. rebootsramblings@gmail.com

title: Sucks

author: Luis Felipe Londoño
comment: I can't see the album art, it only displays the artist, the song title and a black background. What can I do?

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Hi Luis, please send me an email to discuss this and get it working for you. rebootsramblings@gmail.com

author: Mandeep Dhanoa
comment: Keeps on crashing on the moto 360 or stops responding. Even after a restart on both devices

reply.author: Reboot's Ramblings
reply.content: Mandeep, could you please send me a quick email. I use a Moto 360 as my main development platform for this app and don't experience this. rebootsramblings@gmail.com

title: Moto 360 problems

author: rusty gh
comment: Moved from Pebble, was going crazy then found music boss has android! Life saver! Wheewh   :)
title: Awesome!
